messages.subject: undoing damage
messages.msgSnippet: I may never be able to undo the damage done to me by public school or my family, but I can move forward and give love and respect to my children. I can
messages.messageBody:
"I may never be able to undo the damage done to me by public school or my family, but I can move forward and give love and respect to my children. I can communicate with them in a manner that doesn't destroy their curiosity and creativity or squash their self-worth. I can work to reverse the damage done by other family that thinks control and authority is the way to parent by showing that I don't have to be that way. At least, I hope I can."



You can.  Have you ever read "Parenting from the Inside Out"?  Great book to help parent yourself as well as your children in a healthy way.  It helped me so much!!!  Too many of our parents fell prey to society's pushing and shoving children into a mold.  I'm so glad to see so many parents getting back to good parenting. 



Diana

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
